qas.question: How many major medical centers are located in downtown New Haven?

What hospital in New Haven provides notable cardiac emergency care?
How many pavilions comprise Yale -- New Haven Hospital?
What is the mental health facility is located in New Haven?

context: The New Haven area supports several medical facilities that are considered some of the best hospitals in the country. There are <a0_0>two<a0_0/> major medical centers downtown: <a1_0>Yale – New Haven Hospital<a1_0/> has <a3_0><a5_0>four<a3_0/> pavilions<a5_0/>, including the Yale – <a8_0>New Haven Children's Hospital<a8_0/> and the Smilow Cancer Hospital; the <a2_0>Hospital of Saint Raphael<a2_0/> is several blocks north, and touts its excellent cardiac emergency care program. Smaller downtown health facilities are the Temple Medical Center located downtown on Temple Street, <a4_0>Connecticut Mental Health Center<a4_0/>/ across Park Street from Y-NHH, and the <a6_0>Hill Health Center,<a6_0/> which serves the working-class Hill neighborhood. A large Veterans Affairs hospital is located in neighboring <a9_0>West Haven<a9_0/>. To the west in Milford is Milford Hospital, and to the north in Meriden is the <a7_0>MidState Medical Center<a7_0/>.
